Definition / general

* This topic only discusses features of plasmacytoma in lymph nodes different from [plasmacytoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomaplasmacytoma.html) and [myeloma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomamyeloma.html)* Very rare (< 50 reported cases)* Diagnosis of primary plasmacytoma of lymph node requires exclusion of extramedullary plasmacytoma (15% of upper respiratory tract plasmacytomas metastasize to cervical nodes) and myeloma (40% of high stage myelomas metastasize to nodes)* 2/3 male; median age 59 years (range 39 - 76 years)* Often involves cervical nodes* Similar survival to other extramedullary plasmacytomas, although does not progress to myeloma ([Am J Clin Pathol 2001;115:119](11190797), [Hum Pathol 1997;28:1083](9308734))

Case reports

* 65 year old man with cervical and submandibular node involvement ([Korean J Intern Med 2005;20:183](16134778))* 71 year old man with diffuse hypermetabolic lymphadenopathy of chest, abdomen and pelvis ([J Med Case Rep 2019;13:153](31113466))* 81 year old man with Sjögren syndrome ([Pathol Int 1999;49:577](10469404))* Patient with Castleman disease ([Arch Pathol Lab Med 1986;110:157](3511882), [Am J Clin Pathol 1982;78:541](7137088))

Differential diagnosis

* [Castleman disease](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphnodescastleman.html), **plasma cell variant*** [Lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomalpl.html):
    + Also has neoplastic small lymphocytes+ Often shows IgM restriction and *MYD88* gene mutation* [Marginal zone lymphoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomamzlgeneral.html):
      + May have plasmacytoid features but more extensive sampling may reveal B cell component+ [CD20](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd20.html) expression by neoplastic B cells and plasmacytoid cells+ Clonal B cell population by flow; molecular or cytogenetic features of marginal zone lymphoma* [Large cell lymphoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomaALKpositive.html):
        + May have immunoblastic or plasmablastic features* [Plasma cell myeloma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomamyeloma.html) with nodal involvement:
          + Must be excluded by radiographs, bone marrow biopsy* [Plasmablastic lymphoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/lymphomaplasmablastic.html):
            + Mostly extranodal; less frequent nodal involvement+ Associated with HIV or other immunosuppressive states and EBV* [Reactive plasmacytosis](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/bonemarrowplasmacytosis.html):
              + Often follicular hyperplasia+ No light chain restriction
